answers.answer: I do not take prozac, but had a fall....I get the numbness...what type of injury did u get as a result of falling??did u have an MRI?Where u checked to see what the root cause of ur depression is??Good luckGodspeed"selma"

Hi,Thanks for writing in.Burning pain in the arm and wrist and hands can occur as a result of trauma which can result in nerve compression due to fracture and nerve damage.Prozac or Fluoxetine is not known to cause these types of symptoms. Peripheral neuropathy due to diabetes or B12 deficiency can be other causes of burning pain and need to be ruled out.Take care!

question: I have been taking prozac for about two weeks now, this is my second time taking this medicine for depression and anxiety.  Lately I have burning sensation in my arm, wrist and hands.  I am also being treated for a fall that I had back in April -2008.  Is there anyone out there who has had this type of reaction to a fall or antidepresent.Someone please respond
title: Help with Burning and Numbness
